tool.name: datasets
tool.command:
parsec datasets download_dataset --dataset_id "$dataset_id"
#if $file_path --file_path "$file_path" #end if #if $use_default_filename --use_default_filename "$use_default_filename" #end if #if $wait_for_completion --wait_for_completion "$wait_for_completion" #end if #if $maxwait --maxwait "$maxwait" #end if
| jq -S . > $results

input.name: file_path
input.help: If this argument is provided, the dataset will be streamed to disk at that path (should be a directory if use_default_filename=True). If the file_path argument is not provided, the dataset content is loaded into memory and returned by the method (Memory consumption may be heavy as the entire file will be in memory).

input.name: use_default_filename
input.help: If this argument is True, the exported file will be saved as file_path/%s, where %s is the dataset name. If this argument is False, file_path is assumed to contain the full file path including the filename.

input.name: wait_for_completion
input.help: If this argument is True, this method call will block until the dataset is ready. If the dataset state becomes invalid, a DatasetStateException will be thrown.

input.name: maxwait
input.help: Time (in seconds) to wait for dataset to complete. If the dataset state is not complete within this time, a DatasetTimeoutException will be thrown.

tool.help: Download a dataset to file or in memory.
